description.content:
The Configuration API enables you to create a platform where you can onboard your users as account holders and create balance accounts, cards, and business accounts.

## Authentication
Your Adyen contact will provide your API credential and an API key. To connect to the API, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \n-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \n...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication. For example:

```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \n-U "ws@BalancePlatform.YOUR_BALANCE_PLATFORM":"YOUR_WS_PASSWORD" \n...
```
## Versioning
The Configuration API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://balanceplatform-api-test.adyen.com/bcl/v2/accountHolders
```
## Going live
When going live, your Adyen contact will provide your API credential for the live environment. You can then use the API key or the username and password to send requests to `https://balanceplatform-api-live.adyen.com/bcl/v2`.

item.name: /balancePlatforms/:id
item.description: Returns a balance platform.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance platform.

request.description: Returns a balance platform.

item.name: /balancePlatforms/:id/accountHolders
item.description: Returns a paginated list of all the account holders that belong to the balance platform. To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.   For example, to limit the page to 5 account holders and to skip the first 20, use `/balancePlatforms/{id}/accountHolders?limit=5&offset=20`.

item.name: Get all account holders under a balance platform

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance platform.

query.description: The number of items that you want to skip.
The number of items returned per page, maximum 100 items. By default, the response returns 10 items per page.

request.description: Returns a paginated list of all the account holders that belong to the balance platform. To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.   For example, to limit the page to 5 account holders and to skip the first 20, use `/balancePlatforms/{id}/accountHolders?limit=5&offset=20`.

item.name: /grantOffers
item.description: Returns a list of all [grant offers](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/capital#grant-offers) available for `accountHolderId` specified as a query parameter.

query.description: The unique identifier of the grant account.

request.description: Returns a list of all [grant offers](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/capital#grant-offers) available for `accountHolderId` specified as a query parameter.

item.name: /grantOffers/:grantOfferId
item.description: Returns the details of a single grant offer.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the grant offer.

request.description: Returns the details of a single grant offer.

item.name: /paymentInstrumentGroups
item.description: Creates a payment instrument group to associate and group payment instrument resources together. You can apply a transaction rule to a payment instrument group.

request.description: Creates a payment instrument group to associate and group payment instrument resources together. You can apply a transaction rule to a payment instrument group.

item.name: /paymentInstrumentGroups/:id
item.description: Returns the details of a payment instrument group.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument group.

request.description: Returns the details of a payment instrument group.

item.name: /paymentInstrumentGroups/:id/transactionRules
item.description: Returns a list of all the transaction rules associated with a payment instrument group.

item.name: Get all transaction rules for a payment instrument group

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument group.

request.description: Returns a list of all the transaction rules associated with a payment instrument group.

item.name: /networkTokens/:networkTokenId
item.description: Returns the details of a network token.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the network token.

request.description: Returns the details of a network token.

item.name: /networkTokens/:networkTokenId
item.description: Updates the status of the network token.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the network token.

request.description: Updates the status of the network token.

item.name: /accountHolders
item.description: Creates an account holder linked to a [legal entity](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/latest/post/legalEntities).

request.description: Creates an account holder linked to a [legal entity](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/latest/post/legalEntities).

item.description: Returns an account holder.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the account holder.

request.description: Returns an account holder.

item.name: /accountHolders/:id
item.description: Updates an account holder. When updating an account holder resource, if a parameter is not provided in the request, it is left unchanged.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the account holder.

request.description: Updates an account holder. When updating an account holder resource, if a parameter is not provided in the request, it is left unchanged.

request.description: Updates an account holder. When updating an account holder resource, if a parameter is not provided in the request, it is left unchanged.

item.name: /accountHolders/:id/balanceAccounts
item.description: Returns a paginated list of the balance accounts associated with an account holder. To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.   For example, to limit the page to 5 balance accounts and skip the first 10, use `/accountHolders/{id}/balanceAccounts?limit=5&offset=10`.

item.name: Get all balance accounts of an account holder

variable.description: The unique identifier of the account holder.

query.description: The number of items that you want to skip.
The number of items returned per page, maximum 100 items. By default, the response returns 10 items per page.

request.description: Returns a paginated list of the balance accounts associated with an account holder. To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.   For example, to limit the page to 5 balance accounts and skip the first 10, use `/accountHolders/{id}/balanceAccounts?limit=5&offset=10`.

item.name: /accountHolders/:id/taxForms
item.description: Generates a tax form for account holders operating in the US. For more information, refer to [Providing tax forms](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/us-tax-forms/).

variable.description: The unique identifier of the account holder.

query.description: The type of tax form you want to retrieve. Accepted values are **US1099k** and **US1099nec**
The tax year in YYYY format for the tax form you want to retrieve

request.description: Generates a tax form for account holders operating in the US. For more information, refer to [Providing tax forms](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/us-tax-forms/).

item.name: /paymentInstruments
item.description: Creates a payment instrument to issue a physical card, a virtual card, or a business account to your user.   For more information, refer to [Issue cards](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/create-cards) or [Issue business accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/business-accounts).

item.name: Create a business account in NL

request.description: Creates a payment instrument to issue a physical card, a virtual card, or a business account to your user.   For more information, refer to [Issue cards](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/create-cards) or [Issue business accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/business-accounts).

item.name: Create a business account in the US

request.description: Creates a payment instrument to issue a physical card, a virtual card, or a business account to your user.   For more information, refer to [Issue cards](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/create-cards) or [Issue business accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/business-accounts).

Creates a payment instrument to issue a physical card, a virtual card, or a business account to your user.   For more information, refer to [Issue cards](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/create-cards) or [Issue business accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/business-accounts).

Creates a payment instrument to issue a physical card, a virtual card, or a business account to your user.   For more information, refer to [Issue cards](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/create-cards) or [Issue business accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/business-accounts).

item.name: /paymentInstruments/:id
item.description: Returns the details of a payment instrument.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: Returns the details of a payment instrument.

item.name: /paymentInstruments/:id
item.description: Updates a payment instrument. Once a payment instrument is already active, you can only update its status. However, for cards created with **inactive** status, you can still update the balance account associated with the card.

item.name: Update the balance account linked to a payment instrument

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: Updates a payment instrument. Once a payment instrument is already active, you can only update its status. However, for cards created with **inactive** status, you can still update the balance account associated with the card.

item.name: Update the status of a payment instrument

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: Updates a payment instrument. Once a payment instrument is already active, you can only update its status. However, for cards created with **inactive** status, you can still update the balance account associated with the card.

item.name: /paymentInstruments/:id/networkTokens
item.description: List the network tokens connected to a payment instrument.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: List the network tokens connected to a payment instrument.

item.name: /paymentInstruments/:id/reveal
item.description: Returns the primary account number (PAN) of a payment instrument.  To make this request, your API credential must have the following [role](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/manage-access/api-credentials-web-service#api-permissions):  * Balance Platform BCL PCI role

item.name: Get the PAN of a payment instrument

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: Returns the primary account number (PAN) of a payment instrument.  To make this request, your API credential must have the following [role](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/manage-access/api-credentials-web-service#api-permissions):  * Balance Platform BCL PCI role

item.name: /paymentInstruments/:id/transactionRules
item.description: Returns a list of transaction rules associated with a payment instrument.

item.name: Get all transaction rules for a payment instrument

variable.description: The unique identifier of the payment instrument.

request.description: Returns a list of transaction rules associated with a payment instrument.

item.name: /validateBankAccountIdentification
item.description: Validates bank account identification details. You can use this endpoint to validate bank account details before you [make a transfer](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/transfers/latest/post/transfers) or [create a transfer instrument](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/legalentity/latest/post/transferInstruments).

request.description: Validates bank account identification details. You can use this endpoint to validate bank account details before you [make a transfer](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/transfers/latest/post/transfers) or [create a transfer instrument](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/legalentity/latest/post/transferInstruments).

Validates bank account identification details. You can use this endpoint to validate bank account details before you [make a transfer](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/transfers/latest/post/transfers) or [create a transfer instrument](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/legalentity/latest/post/transferInstruments).

item.name: /grantAccounts/:id
item.description: Returns the details of the [grant account](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/capital#grant-account).

request.description: Returns the details of the [grant account](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/capital#grant-account).

item.name: /balanceAccounts
item.description: Creates a balance account that holds the funds of the associated account holder.

request.description: Creates a balance account that holds the funds of the associated account holder.

item.name: /balanceAccounts/:balanceAccountId/sweeps
item.description: Returns a list of the sweeps configured for a balance account.  To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters. For example, to limit the page to 5 sweeps and to skip the first 10, use `/balanceAccounts/{balanceAccountId}/sweeps?limit=5&offset=10`.

item.name: Get all sweeps for a balance account

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.

query.description: The number of items that you want to skip.
The number of items returned per page, maximum 100 items. By default, the response returns 10 items per page.

request.description: Returns a list of the sweeps configured for a balance account.  To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters. For example, to limit the page to 5 sweeps and to skip the first 10, use `/balanceAccounts/{balanceAccountId}/sweeps?limit=5&offset=10`.

item.name: /balanceAccounts/:balanceAccountId/sweeps
item.description: Creates a sweep that results in moving funds from or to a balance account.  A sweep pulls in or pushes out funds based on a defined schedule, amount, currency, and a source or a destination.

item.name: Create a sweep to pull funds in to a balance account

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.

request.description: Creates a sweep that results in moving funds from or to a balance account.  A sweep pulls in or pushes out funds based on a defined schedule, amount, currency, and a source or a destination.

item.name: Create a sweep to push funds out of a balance account

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.

request.description: Creates a sweep that results in moving funds from or to a balance account.  A sweep pulls in or pushes out funds based on a defined schedule, amount, currency, and a source or a destination.

item.name: Create a sweep to push funds out of a balance account with set priorities

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.

request.description: Creates a sweep that results in moving funds from or to a balance account.  A sweep pulls in or pushes out funds based on a defined schedule, amount, currency, and a source or a destination.

item.description: Deletes a sweep for a balance account.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.
The unique identifier of the sweep.

request.description: Deletes a sweep for a balance account.

item.description: Returns a sweep.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.
The unique identifier of the sweep.

request.description: Returns a sweep.

item.name: /balanceAccounts/:balanceAccountId/sweeps/:sweepId
item.description: Updates a sweep. When updating a sweep resource, note that if a request parameter is not provided, the parameter is left unchanged.

item.name: Update the status of a sweep

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.
The unique identifier of the sweep.

request.description: Updates a sweep. When updating a sweep resource, note that if a request parameter is not provided, the parameter is left unchanged.

To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.For example, to limit the page to 3 payment instruments and to skip the first 6, use `/balanceAccounts/{id}/paymentInstruments?limit=3&offset=6`.

item.name: Get all payment instruments for a balance account

variable.description: The unique identifier of the balance account.

query.description: The number of items that you want to skip.
The number of items returned per page, maximum 100 items. By default, the response returns 10 items per page.

To fetch multiple pages, use the query parameters.For example, to limit the page to 3 payment instruments and to skip the first 6, use `/balanceAccounts/{id}/paymentInstruments?limit=3&offset=6`.

item.name: /transactionRules
item.description: Creates a [transaction rule](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules). When your user makes a transaction with their Adyen-issued card, the transaction is allowed or declined based on the conditions and outcome defined in the transaction rule. You can apply the transaction rule to several cards, such as all the cards in your platform, or to a specific card. For use cases, see [examples](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules/examples).

request.description: Creates a [transaction rule](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules). When your user makes a transaction with their Adyen-issued card, the transaction is allowed or declined based on the conditions and outcome defined in the transaction rule. You can apply the transaction rule to several cards, such as all the cards in your platform, or to a specific card. For use cases, see [examples](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules/examples).

item.name: Increase the score of a card

request.description: Creates a [transaction rule](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules). When your user makes a transaction with their Adyen-issued card, the transaction is allowed or declined based on the conditions and outcome defined in the transaction rule. You can apply the transaction rule to several cards, such as all the cards in your platform, or to a specific card. For use cases, see [examples](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules/examples).

item.name: Limit total amount in the last 12 hours

request.description: Creates a [transaction rule](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules). You can apply the transaction rule to several cards, such as all the cards in your platform, or to a specific card. For use cases, see [examples](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules/examples).

Creates a [transaction rule](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules). When your user makes a transaction with their Adyen-issued card, the transaction is allowed or declined based on the conditions and outcome defined in the transaction rule. You can apply the transaction rule to several cards, such as all the cards in your platform, or to a specific card. For use cases, see [examples](https://docs.adyen.com/issuing/transaction-rules/examples).

item.name: /transactionRules/:transactionRuleId
item.description: Deletes a transaction rule.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the transaction rule.

request.description: Deletes a transaction rule.

item.name: /transactionRules/:transactionRuleId
item.description: Returns the details of a transaction rule.

variable.description: The unique identifier of the transaction rule.

request.description: Returns the details of a transaction rule.

item.name: /transactionRules/:transactionRuleId
item.description: Updates a transaction rule.   * To update only the status of a transaction rule, send only the `status` parameter. All other parameters not provided in the request are left unchanged.  * When updating any other parameter, you need to send all existing resource parameters. If you omit a parameter in the request, that parameter is removed from the resource.

item.name: Update the interval of transaction rule

variable.description: The unique identifier of the transaction rule.

request.description: Updates a transaction rule.   * To update only the status of a transaction rule, send only the `status` parameter. All other parameters not provided in the request are left unchanged.  * When updating any other parameter, you need to send all existing resource parameters. If you omit a parameter in the request, that parameter is removed from the resource.

item.name: /transferRoutes/calculate
item.description: Returns available transfer routes based on a combination of transfer `country`, `currency`, `counterparty`, and `priorities`. Use this endpoint to find optimal transfer priorities and associated requirements before you [make a transfer](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/transfers/latest/post/transfers).

request.description: Returns available transfer routes based on a combination of transfer `country`, `currency`, `counterparty`, and `priorities`. Use this endpoint to find optimal transfer priorities and associated requirements before you [make a transfer](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/transfers/latest/post/transfers).
